reviewText: I have seen megadeth 3 times on headlining tours, but none as big as this tour.  Unfortunately, they did not come around my neck of the woods when this tour thundered across the USA.  However, with this DVD, you can experience at least a small flavor of what all most of the bands had to offer.  Spearheaded by Megadeth, and the brainchild of Dave Mustaine, this concert grabs you by the throat and doesn't let go until it's over.  Other highlights are Dream Theater, Fear Factory, Life of Agony, Nevermore, Symphony X, Dry Kill Logic, and Bobaflex.  The glaring omission on the live DVD is Anthrax, but that does not deminish from the power of this tour, and the excellence of this DVD.  The CD and the DVD are all currently very reasonably priced, and should be added to the collections of all fans of Metal and Musicianship.  Plus, the bonus dvd with backstage and behind the scenes muckary is nice to see that the bands were having fun, as should you watching the show.  Highly recommended.
summary: A List of Top Notch  Metal Bands at their best, a must own for a RATTLEHEAD!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: With my all time favorite Megadeth, Fear Factory and progressive metalist Dream Theater in tow, you can't be wrong. In this DVD, I became an instant fan of Nevermore and Symphony X. Hope that they will be releasing thier own DVD soon. All in all, this is worth watching except I just can't bear watching Bobaflex...Anyway, I will be waiting for Gigantour 2 since all the lineup is awesome with Arch Enemy, Opeth and Soulfly....Hope that it will be realsed soon....For now, enjoy the first offering by Dave Mustaine.....
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the only way you can see "Panic Attack" and the "Glass Prison" live, because the upcoming Score DVD will not include these two songs. I'm really mad I missed this tour, because I love Dream Theater, Symphony X, and even Megadeth to some extent. At least now I can catch these performances on DVD.
summary: Worth Watching for Dream Theater Alone

reviewText: Symphony X on DVD - it's good, but where ANTHRAX ??? I think :  must have for metal fans
Title: N/A

reviewText: I agree with the reviewers here...With the pedigree of bands playing here,and the dvds they have released before ( rude awakening,live at the budokan etc.) I felt a bit shortchanged by what i got here,production and performance wise...Bobafuk n Dry kill shouldnt even be here.The other bands are good,but I wish Deth had done the extended version of She wolf and we had some more songs from DT and Nevermore.Also,considering this tour was close to 4 months long,the potential for a good chunk of Bonus material was immense...like band interviews and Gear talk ( check out the ARCH ENEMY DVD..I bought it along with this and it smokes )...The only good thing on the bonus disc here is the cemetary gates cover.
Title: N/A
